title: Altaba's stock trading 73% below prior day's close to reflect pre-dissolution distribution
text: Shares of Altaba Inc. AABA, +1.63% were trading in Tuesday's premarket at a price that is 73% below Monday's close, following its previously announced cash distribution as part of investment fund's liquidation plan. The company announced earlier this month a distribution of $51.50 in cash per share, to be paid Sept. 23 to shareholders of record on Sept. 16. The stock closed at $70.80 on Monday. Late Monday, the company said it plans to file a certificate of dissolution following the close of trading on Oct. 4, after which the company will close its stock transfer books. "The Fund expects that any purchases or sales of the Fund's shares that are not settled prior to the filing of the certificate of dissolution and the closing of the Fund's stock transfer books will not be settled," Altaba said in a statement. "Consequently, stockholders who hold their share directly on the books of the Fund's transfer agent [Computershare] and will to sell shares prior to the closing of the fund's stock transfer books will not be able to do so after September 25, 2019 other than through an account with a bank, broker or other participant in [The Depository Trust Company]."
